intro: Gymnophragma simplex, commonly known as the smooth gymnophragma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, smooth leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or savannas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
